channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Alice Stewart, a CNN Political Commentator, Dies at 58
item.description: She had appeared onscreen as a conservative commentator since the 2016 presidential race. A political strategist, she had worked for Republican presidential candidates.

item.title: Jürgen Klopp and Liverpool, a Love Affair in Street Art and Silverware
item.description: A coach’s soccer legacy is often reduced to titles and trophies. In Liverpool, a beloved manager will endure in murals, music and shared memories.

item.title: Benny Gantz threatens to leave Israel’s war cabinet if Netanyahu doesn’t meet demands, warning against ‘path of fanatics’ that will lead to the ‘abyss’
item.description: “Personal and political considerations began to penetrate the Holy of Holies — Israel’s security.”

item.title: Jürgen Klopp and Liverpool, a Love Affair in Street Art and Silverware
item.description: A coach’s soccer legacy is often reduced to titles and trophies. In Liverpool, a beloved manager will endure in murals, music and shared memories.

item.title: Are Those Mimes Spying on Us? In Pakistan, It’s Not a Strange Question.
item.description: Pakistanis suspect the national intelligence agencies of being behind practically everything — even street performers working for tips in Islamabad.

item.title: Bankrupt crypto lender Genesis gets OK to return billions in tokens and cash to creditors, meaning parent firm DCG ‘is out of the money’
item.description: “Given the size of the creditor claims, DCG is out of the money as an equity holder by billions of dollars,” Judge Lane said.

item.title: Are Those Mimes Spying on Us? In Pakistan, It’s Not a Strange Question.
item.description: Pakistanis suspect the national intelligence agencies of being behind practically everything — even street performers working for tips in Islamabad.

item.title: Being Muslim in Modi’s India
item.description: Families grapple with anguish and isolation as they try to raise their children in a country that increasingly questions their very identity.

item.title: Aging while exercising? Great. Just be sure to reevaluate your routine.
item.description: “We need to think about changing the program to be effective and to be safe," notes one expert.

item.title: Being Muslim in Modi’s India
item.description: Families grapple with anguish and isolation as they try to raise their children in a country that increasingly questions their very identity.

item.title: Russia Presses Attacks in Northeast Ukraine, Seeking Buffer Zone on Border
item.description: Advances by Russian forces have raised fears that they could bring their artillery in range of Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second-largest city.

item.title: An oil tanker going from Russia to China is hit by a Houthi missile in the Red Sea, U.S. military says
item.description: The strike Saturday on the Greek-owned M/T Wind caused flooding that knocked out its propulsion and steering, which the crew restored.

item.title: Russia Presses Attacks in Northeast Ukraine, Seeking Buffer Zone on Border
item.description: Advances by Russian forces have raised fears that they could bring their artillery in range of Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second-largest city.

item.title: Israel’s Wartime Government Frays as Frustration with Netanyahu Grows
item.description: Benny Gantz, a centrist member of leadership, presented the prime minister with an ultimatum that demanded a plan for the future of Israel’s war.

item.title: Some NYU students being disciplined for protests must reflect on a ‘Simpsons’ episode: ‘What, if anything, could Lisa have done or thought about to make better decisions?’
item.description: One workbook has a section based on an episode of “The Simpsons” in which Lisa uncharacteristically cheats on a test and is wracked by guilt.
